conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
Particle A: The acceleration phase occurs from t = 0 to t = t_0. The velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2v_0.
Particle B: The acceleration phase occurs from t = 0 to t = 5t_0. The velocity increases linearly from 0 to v_0.
Calculate the acceleration for Particle A using the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Acceleration for Particle A: a_A = (2v_0 - 0) / t_0 = 2v_0 / t_0.
Calculate the acceleration for Particle B using the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Acceleration for Particle B: a_B = (v_0 - 0) / 5t_0 = v_0 / 5t_0.
Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B is 10.
